title: Subtle Anterior STEMI Calculator (4-Variable)
desc: The Subtle Anterior STEMI Calculator (4-Variable) differentiates normal variant ST elevation (benign early repolarization) from anterior STEMI, more sensitive than 3-variable version.

orgreference.text: Driver BE, Khalil A, Henry T, Kazmi F, Adil A, Smith SW. A new 4-variable formula to differentiate normal variant ST segment elevation in V2-V4 (early repolarization) from subtle left anterior descending coronary occlusion - Adding QRS amplitude of V2 improves the model. J Electrocardiol. 2017;50(5):561-569.

other_refer.text: Smith SW, Khalil A, Henry TD, et al. Electrocardiographic differentiation of early repolarization from subtle anterior ST-segment elevation myocardial infarction. Ann Emerg Med. 2012;60(1):45-56.e2.

data.evidence: Subtle Anterior STEMI 4-Variable Calculation = 0.052 x (Bazett-corrected QT interval, ms) - 0.151 x (QRS amplitude in lead V2, mm) - 0.268 x (R wave amplitude in lead V4, mm) + 1.062 x (ST segment elevation 60 ms after the J point in lead V3, mm)
data.facts:
Interpretation:

Scores ≥18.2 are likely to be anterior STEMI (83.3% sensitivity, 87.7% specificity, and 85.9% diagnostic accuracy).

Scores <18.2 are likely to be benign early repolarization.

inputs.label_en: R wave amplitude in lead V4
inputs.name: rwave

inputs.label_en: ST segment elevation 60 ms after the J point in lead V3
inputs.name: st
